BlackNightmare:

Ideas and feelings was spinning inside the femme as hurricane, 
altough her outside remained calm, a aparently calm that needed all 
her self-dicipline to remain in that way.

She acted as if anything had happened... by now.

"is all ok with our pet, sis?"said cooly the femme

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley <bustercross365@y...> 
wrote:
> Malice/ Hellplague:
>  
> Malice heard Blacknightmare walk in.  He paniced and pushed 
Hellplague back and tried to set up.  He succeeded in sitting up, a 
look of confusion and embarressment all over his face.  He tried to 
explain, but ended up red faced and tougue tied.
>  
> Hellplague sat up with a satisfied look on her face.  She 
straightened up and sat up.  She took the sensor from Blacknightmare 
and checked it.  She pushed Malice on his back and set to work 
replacing the sensor.
> 
> airly2000 <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> BlackNightmare:
> 
> BlackNightmare arrived at that time and she looked shocke all, she 
> had jealous and rage, but she remember what same had happened when 
> Malice kissed her... It was a wiked way to force a fight among 
> then??? doubt was raisen until she decides to speak "Err sis, I 
> found it..."
> 
> She need all her control to say that and seem calmed
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley <bustercross365@y...> 
> wrote:
> > Malice/ Hellplague:
> >  
> > After Blacknightmare left to get the new sensor, Hellplague 
> reached into Malice's exposed chest.  She drummed her fingers on 
his 
> spark chamber.  Malice took a sharp breath, it really freaked him 
> out to have someone touching his spark chamber.  Hellplague 
giggled 
> and laid down next Malice.  He looked at her with a mix expression 
> of relief and suprise.
> > "Please, don't do that.  It feels really weird." he said.
> > Hellplague grinned and the moved in to kiss him.  As she did, 
her 
> hand reurned to drumming on his spark chamber.  Their lips met, 
and 
> Malice was motionless.  Hellplague enjoyed the act, and deepened 
the 
> kiss.
